title: ieee_fraud automl type selection on master fails in preprocessing
body:
Problem can be reproduced by running:
https://github.com/ludwig-ai/experiments/blob/main/automl/heuristics/ieee_fraud/run_auto_train_1hr.py

which produces this stack trace:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run_auto_train_1hr.py", line 13, in <module>
    tune_for_memory=False
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/automl/automl.py", line 103, in auto_train
    return train_with_config(dataset, config, output_directory=output_directory, random_seed=random_seed, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/automl/automl.py", line 172, in train_with_config
    config, dataset, output_directory=output_directory, model_name=model_name, random_seed=random_seed, **kwargs
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/automl/automl.py", line 262, in _train
    **kwargs,
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/hyperopt/run.py", line 292, in hyperopt
    random_seed=random_seed,
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/api.py", line 1279, in preprocess
    callbacks=self.callbacks,
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1403, in preprocess_for_training
    callbacks=callbacks,
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 231, in preprocess_for_training
    callbacks=callbacks,
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1559, in _preprocess_df_for_training
    mode="training",
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1054, in build_dataset
    metadata = build_metadata(metadata, dataset_cols, feature_configs, global_preprocessing_parameters, backend)
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1159, in build_metadata
    column, preprocessing_parameters, backend
  File "/home/ray/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/features/binary_feature.py", line 101, in get_feature_meta
    f"Binary feature column {column.name} expects 2 distinct values, "
ValueError: Binary feature column M1 expects 2 distinct values, found: ['T', '0', 'F']
```
